intro: Hyperacanthus mandenensis, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks. It has a short stem and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
